image.altText: A silhouette of a woman's head and shoulders.

props.synopsis: Parents of potential victims of alleged child sex offender Joshua Dale Brown speak of their horror at finding out their children could have been abused or contracted STIs.

title.children: Parents who sent their kids to centres where alleged predator worked speak out

image.altText: Sean "Diddy" Combs dressed in a suit and bowtie not smiling

props.synopsis: A New York jury returns a split verdict in the high-profile criminal trial against Sean "Diddy" Combs, finding him guilty of transportation to engage in prostitution, but not guilty of sex trafficking and racketeering conspiracy.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs not guilty of sex trafficking, convicted of lesser charge

image.altText: Qantas logo on Sydney Airport terminal glass

props.synopsis: Qantas is warning a "significant" amount of customer data has likely been stolen from its records during a cyber attack against the airline on Monday.

title.children: Qantas says 'significant' portion of 6m customers' data likely stolen

image.altText: man with shaves head, orange and red robes sits on chat with woman with red and white hat waving arms.

props.synopsis: The Dalai Lama confirms his centuries-old tradition will continue, with his charitable foundation the only authority to recognise his future reincarnation.

title.children: Dalai Lama affirms succession plan for after his death, heartening supporters

image.altText: Ye wears a black tee and jeans, Censori wears a black fur coat

props.synopsis: The musician had a valid visa cancelled by officials in Tony Burke's department after he released a song titled Heil Hitler.

title.children: Minister reveals Kanye West was denied entry to Australia

image.altText: Big swell and large waves on Sydney's Northern Beaches brought on by bad weather along the NSW east coast.

props.synopsis: The system has now reached peak intensity in terms of pressure and its pressure and peak winds remain equivalent to the strength of a tropical cyclone near the boundary between category one and category two.

title.children: Low-pressure system off NSW coast equivalent to category one cyclone

image.altText: Duhan van der Merwe of the Lions scores a try

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions have continued their roaring start to the Australian tour, defeating the Queensland Reds 52-12.

title.children: Lions win in style over physical Reds, but at a cost with Daly injury

image.altText: Iranian president stands at a podium in front of an Iranian flag. He has short white hair.

props.synopsis: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has ordered the country to suspend its cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency after US and Israeli air strikes hit its key nuclear facilities.

title.children: Iran suspends cooperation with UN nuclear watchdog

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Police are examining whether the former nurse may have committed other crimes at hospitals where she worked.

title.children: Prosecutors consider further charges against Lucy Letby

image.altText: Servicemen from the mobile air defence unit of the 115th Separate Mechanized Brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces firing weapon

props.synopsis: Ukraine is appealing to the US envoy in Kyiv after Washington halted some shipments of critical weapons to the war-embattled country.

title.children: Ukraine warns cutting off US weapons shipments will 'only encourage Russia'

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman in a raincoat stands in front of a wild sea crashing on a beach.

props.synopsis: Residents of Wamberal Beach on the NSW Central Coast, where homes partially collapsed during savage weather in 2020, say work to mitigate erosion should have started months ago.

title.children: Beachfront residents 'sitting ducks' as emergency works ramp up

image.altText: People recline on marble steps outside the US Captiol. The building's domed roof can be seen in the bakground

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump is getting closer to seeing his One Big Beautiful Bill Act passed after it narrowly passed a Senate vote. Here's why the bill isn't enjoying full Republican support.

title.children: Why Republicans are voting against Trump's Big Beautiful Bill

image.altText: A photo of the painting The Birth of Venus being taken on a smartphone.

props.synopsis: Smart devices are becoming more sophisticated and we're increasingly using them to document our lives in minute detail. But research suggests this is changing the way we think — and remember.

title.children: How storing your life on your phone changes the way you think

image.altText: A massive ball of flames and smoke rises from an electrical substation at night

props.synopsis: The airport was closed for most of March 21, affecting thousands of passengers around the world and costing airlines millions in lost revenue.

title.children: 'Catastrophic failure' led to fire that shut Heathrow Airport, report finds

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt

props.synopsis: Mr Renouf has been charged with driving under the influence of liquor after allegedly being pulled over by police in Brisbane's inner north.

title.children: Steve Renouf apologises after drink driving charge

image.altText: Brent Wyndham in police uniform walking next to another policeman outside Geraldton courthouse.

props.synopsis: A Western Australian coroner finds the fatal shooting of an Indigenous woman by police on a Geraldton street was preventable, and has made nine recommendations to prevent a similar outcome in the future.

title.children: Coroner finds police officer acted 'too hastily' before shooting woman dead

props.synopsis: Quake, sonic boom or something extraterrestrial? Experts are so far unable to determine the source of a short, loud sound that shook homes and startled residents in north-west Victoria.

title.children: Big bang theories abound as mystery blast rattles north-west Victoria

image.altText: A lean man wearing exercise clothes sits on a couch, with his faced blurred to prevent identification.

props.synopsis: Papua New Guinea police say they will charge a 45-year-old NSW man with serious drug trafficking offences after allegedly catching him with millions of dollars worth of cocaine at a hotel in Port Moresby.

title.children: Australian allegedly caught with 60 kilograms of cocaine in PNG

image.altText: A large sign that read "Golden North" near a factory in a country area.

props.synopsis: Golden North Ice Cream is moving its operations from Laura to Murray Bridge in order to be closer to its milk suppliers.

title.children: SA ice cream company moving to new town after more than 100 years

image.altText: A Disney cruise line ship in the ocean, with a red dotted outline drawn around a deck low on the side.

props.synopsis: Witnesses aboard the Disney Dream say the five-year-old's father jumped in after her and trod water for more than 10 minutes until a rescue boat reached them.

title.children: Father jumps off Disney cruise ship to rescue daughter who fell overboard

image.altText: A flying fox with its wings outstretched next to a tree branch filled with flying foxes.

props.synopsis: NSW Health says the man received treatment after a bat bit him months ago but he is now in hospital in a critical condition.

title.children: Man contracts first confirmed NSW case of 'rabies-like' bat disease

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Cheshire Police says the investigation into corporate manslaughter offences does not have any impact on Lucy Letby's 2023 convictions for murder and attempted murder.

title.children: Police arrest hospital bosses where killer nurse Lucy Letby worked

image.altText: Commissioner Travis Lovett at the Walk for Truth.

props.synopsis: After more than four years and over 1,300 submissions, Australia's first Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry has handed down its final report, calling for major reform.

title.children: 'This was a genocide': Findings from nation's first Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry

image.altText: Steve Smith looks sick as Beau Webster gestures for trainers.

props.synopsis: Steve Smith is set to bat with a splint on his dislocated finger when he returns for Australia's second Test against the West Indies in Grenada.

title.children: Australia's fragile top order bolstered ahead of Windies Test

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns at a press conference in Parramatta, near microphones and talking in a suit.

props.synopsis: The government will move to ban people from appealing if their working with children check is denied, after media reports highlighting cases where sex offenders and other criminals had been granted the checks on appeal.

title.children: NSW to ban people from appealing if working with children check denied

image.altText: Smoke billows from a volcano rising from tropical rainforest.

props.synopsis: The worker's potentially illegal employment was among numerous issues uncovered by a comprehensive audit of the Shire of Coolgardie's books.

title.children: Outback council staffer was working from Caribbean island, audit finds

image.altText: China's Liaoning aircraft  carrier in South China Sea

props.synopsis: Fiji's Prime Minister Sitiveni Rabuka has delivered a blow to China's security ambitions in the Pacific, declaring his country would "not welcome" any Chinese military bases in the region.

title.children: China's military bases 'not welcome' in the Pacific, Fiji PM says

image.altText: A traditional-looking housewife smiles at the camera as she holds a pie standing in a pink-coloured pantry

props.synopsis: What is it about the tradwife movement and its strict traditional gender roles that has struck a chord with modern day mothers?

title.children: These modern stay-at-home mums are redefining what it means to be a tradwife

image.altText: A man standing in front of a blue painting smiles gently

props.synopsis: After controversially and suddenly withdrawing Khaled Sabsabi and Michael Dagostino from the 2026 Venice Biennale, Creative Australia has announced it has reversed its decision.

title.children: Khaled Sabsabi reinstated as Australia's representative at 2026 Venice Biennale

image.altText: Penny Wong and Marco Rubio smile and shake hands next to their national flags.

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong says the Trump administration has expressed to her its regret that US President Donald Trump did not meet with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese on the sidelines of the G7.

title.children: White House expresses regrets for ditching Albanese meeting

image.altText: A woman with her daughter, smiling for the camera

props.synopsis: Unless you’re a teacher, it’s common for school holidays to total more than an annual leave allocation. So how do parents and guardians manage work and school holidays with limited leave? Parents share their experiences.

title.children: 'A nightmare': How parents navigate school holidays and work

image.altText: Donald Trump and Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stand shoulder to shoulder and pose for a photo at the entrance of the White House.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says Israel has agreed "to the necessary conditions to finalise" a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza.

title.children: Trump says Israel agrees to 'conditions to finalise' 60-day Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: Zohran Mamdani

props.synopsis: "There's a real assembly line for incoming politicians that has changed the nature of the kinds of people that get elected," a political academic tells the ABC.

title.children: Zohran Mamdani's win highlights one thing America is doing better than us

image.altText: A hooded man holds a laptop computer as cyber code is projected on him.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity experts say the Qantas data breach bears the hallmarks of the aggressive Scattered Spider hacker group that is believed to be targeting the airline industry.

title.children: What we know about Scattered Spider, the hacker group targeting airlines

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Brandon D'Alessandro is jailed after pleading guilty to more than 40 charges, including aggravated burglary, theft, and driving a stolen car.

title.children: Getaway driver for group that stole $200 worth of Subway cookies jailed
